title: Ranthambore National Park
short_description: A premier tiger reserve where history meets wilderness, with the ancient Ranthambore Fort standing guard over the jungle.
long_description: Ranthambore National Park is one of the biggest and most renowned national parks in Northern India. Located in the Sawai Madhopur district of southeastern Rajasthan, it is famous for its Bengal Tiger population, often spotted basking in the sun or hunting near the ancient ruins of Ranthambore Fort. The park's diverse landscape comprises dry deciduous forests and open grassy meadows, dotted with several lakes and rivers. Ranthambore offers a unique blend of nature and history, where wild cats roam freely amidst cenotaphs, ruins, and the majestic 10th-century fortress that towers over the park.
wildlife_significance: A major Project Tiger reserve known for its diurnal tigers that have no fear of humans/vehicles.
major_experiences: Visit Ranthambore Fort (UNESCO World Heritage Site)
guides_and_tips: Zones 1-5 are considered core zones with better chances of sightings. Book months in advance via the Rajasthan SSO portal.
how_to_reach: By Rail: Sawai Madhopur (11 km) is a major station. By Air: Jaipur (160 km) is the nearest airport.
permits_and_fees: Permits must be booked online via Rajasthan Government portal. ID proof is verified at entry.
conservation_notes: Strictly monitored to prevent poaching. Conservation efforts have successfully stabilized the tiger population.
sample_itinerary: Day 1: Arrival. Visit Ranthambore Fort. Sunset at Padam Talao. Day 2: Morning Safari in Zone 3/4. Breakfast. Leisure. Afternoon Safari in Zone 2/5. Day 3: Visit National Chambal Sanctuary (nearby). Departure.
safety_tips: Winters are very cold in morning safaris; carry heavy woolens. Dusty tracks require face masks/scarves.

entry_fees.notes: Base entry fee. Safari costs extra.

opening_hours.time_notes: Timings vary monthly based on sunrise/sunset. Typically 6:30-10:00 AM and 2:30-6:00 PM.

operating_season.season_notes: Buffer zones (6-10) may remain open in monsoon.

pricing_metadata.disclaimer: Official government booking is the cheapest but sells out fast. Agents charge premiums.
